clinical_study.brief_title: A Multidisciplinary Intervention Including a Clinical Decision Support System and an App for Drug Therapy Management in Older Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Applicabilità ed Efficacia di un Approccio Multi-Disciplinare Comprendente un Sistema Informatico di Supporto Per la Decisione Della Terapia di Pazienti Anziani Polipatologici

lead_sponsor.agency: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

clinical_study.source: Azienda Ospedaliera Città della Salute e della Scienza di Torino

brief_summary.textblock:
"La Casa nel Parco" (CANP) Project is a European Union and Regione Piemonte funded multidisciplinary project aimed to explore innovative technology application in older subject care. In this context, FARMA-CANP is a randomized open-label clinical trial evaluating a multidisciplinary intervention in older patients hospitalized at home. The intervention involves physicians, pharmacists, nurses and includes a Clinical Decision Support System to help the processes of therapeutic review and reconciliation, and an end-user App to support patients and/or caregivers in the daily management of drug therapy.
The main objectives of the study are to evaluate the impact of the intervention on 1) medication adherence after discharge 2) medication appropriateness.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with a therapeutic adherence index ≥0.8
primary_outcome.time_frame: 6 months after Hospital at Home discharge
primary_outcome.description: The therapeutic adherence index is defined as the ratio of number of drug units dispensed on total number of drug units prescribed at discharge. Data on drug units dispensed will be derived from a central database of territorial pharmaceutical center of A.S.L.Città di Torino.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate Prescriptions (PIP) and number of participants with at least one Beers' PIP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Hospital at Home discharge, an average of 14 days after group allocation
secondary_outcome.description: Beers' PIPs will be identified according to the Beers' 2019 Criteria

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Potentially Inappropriate Prescriptions (PIP) and number of participants with at least one Screening Tool of Older People's Prescriptions (STOPP) PIP
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Hospital at Home discharge, an average of 14 days after group allocation
secondary_outcome.description: STOPP IPs will be identified according to the Screening Tool of Older People's Prescriptions version 2

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of potential contraindicated and/or major Drug-Drug Interactions (DDI) and number of participants with at least one potential contraindicated and/or major DDI.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At Hospital at Home discharge, an average of 14 days after group allocation
secondary_outcome.description: Potential contraindicated and major DDIs will be identified using the Micromedex database

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants with medium or good medication self-reported adherence
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1, 3 and 6 months after Hospital at Home discharge
secondary_outcome.description: Medium or good medication self-reported adherence will be evaluated with a phone call to the patient/caregiver using the Morisky Medication Adherence Scale 8 (MMAS-8) ≥6

arm_group.description: Multidisciplinary medication review and reconciliation during hospitalization involving geriatricians, nurses, pharmacists and supported by a Clinical Decision Support System, followed by an end-user App to support patients/caregivers in the correct drug intake after discharge.

Medication review and reconciliation will be performed by geriatricians according to Good Clinical Practice and usual habits, that might also include digital and printed supports for medication appropriateness and drug interaction. Drug therapy will be listed and explained to the patient/caregiver at discharge. Patients/caregivers will be allowed to use any tools to support medication adherence, according to their habits and preferences (i.e. calendars, alarms, pill boxes).

intervention.description: Geriatricians will introduce medication review data on a Clinical Decision Support System, that will help both pharmacists and physicians in medication reconciliation, highligting potentially inappropriate prescriptions according to Beers' criteria and STOPP/START criteria, and potential controindicated and major Drug-Drug Interactions according to Micromedex. Before Hospital at Home discharge, nurses will instruct patients and/or caregivers to the use of an App, where daily drug therapy at discharge will be inserted and scheduled. This App will automatically create an alert everytime a drug dose needs to be taken, alongside an image of the specific drug packaging. The App will register if and when the patient actually takes the drug, or the reason for the delayed/missed dose.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient age ≥ 65 years
- Hospital at Home admission
- Presence of a caregiver
- Written informed consent signed by both the patient and the caregiver
Exclusion Criteria:
- Unavailable internet access and/or portable device to install the App on
- Severe cognitive impairment with behavioural symptoms
- Estimated life expectancy less than 3 months
- Death during Hospital at Home stay
- Hospital at Home discharge to an other healthcare facility (i.e. Emergency Department, Nursing Home)
- No regular medications precribed at Hospital at Home discharge.
